review: I went to Ironhack Paris with Tom (whom I paid for to), the teaching is OK. I also did a bootcamp named Web@cadémie before that. They're just freelance web developers teaching beginner stuff and if your resume and your pitch looks good enough they might recruit you with their sponsors otherwise you'll end up with a useless digital piece of paper. If you wanna reconvert to web developer this isn't for you! What I did after Ironhack? McDonald's!

Arrogant staff and teacher assistant. They behave as they are doing you a favor and the reason is in the line below.
The quality of education is low—worth half of what they charge. The reason is that most students don’t pay: their government pays for them (Germany and France), and Spanish and Portuguese students get a deal where they only pay when (or if) they find a job. In conclusion, people don’t pay, so they accept anything they get.
The teacher and the management have zero experience in the tech industry. Their first job in tech is teaching… They are all former students. Very weird business format.
The career advisors are a joke. Their English is “Berry Bad,” and if they have a partnership with any company—which I doubt—they will, of course, favor the students who will pay them when they get a job.
Before I chose Ironhack, I read reviews saying exactly the same things I’m writing now, but I didn’t consider them. That was my biggest mistake. I should have chosen LeWagon, Code Academy, or any other school.
the only positive thing was the leading teacher, he was a cool guy but he couldn't do much in such a bad company. The students were also nice too. Anyway if you are thinking of paying their fee you will regret.

I'm writing this review with a mix of frustration and disappointment after my initial interaction with Gabriel Álvarez, Admissions Associate at Ironhack. Unfortunately, my experience was utterly disheartening, and I felt compelled to share my concerns.
Before even enrolling in the program, I reached out to Mr. Álvarez with genuine enthusiasm and curiosity about the Data Science & AI program. However, his response left me feeling belittled, unheard, and disrespected. His tone was abrasive, and he seemed more interested in pushing me toward a bootcamp than in understanding my aspirations or addressing my questions.
As a prospective student, I had high hopes and a deep desire to learn from Ironhack's esteemed program. But Mr. Álvarez's unprofessional demeanor and lack of empathy crushed my excitement and made me question the institution's values.
Given this distressing experience, I have decided not to pursue the program further. I hope that Ironhack will take my feedback to heart and work on improving their customer service, admissions process, and overall student experience.
I would caution prospective students to carefully evaluate their options and consider multiple factors before making a decision.

The bootcamp has truly exceeded my expectations. Throughout the process, there were ups and downs, but overcoming each and every project gave me a huge boost of confidence. I feel extremely proud of what I’ve accomplished and deeply grateful to my instructor and everyone involved in organizing the bootcamp.
Ironhack not only equipped me with technical skills but also taught me the importance of resilience and problem-solving. I highly recommend it to anyone looking to level up their skills and grow both personally and professionally.  
Here, a ProcessTruster — David - RMT WD FT 2025-01-13

Great course contents, engaging staff, especially the teacher that made learning complex concepts easy.
Completely worth the time and the money invested.
It was an amazing experience, specially the threat recibed from the teachers, if you are interested in a review or upgrade of your cybersecurity skills its great.

Curso de Web Development tiempo completo:
Curso de desarrollo web a tiempo completo:
Esta ha sido una experiencia mejor de lo que esperaba. Pensé que podría ser demasiada información, pero era la cantidad justa para digerir y ejecutar. ¡Maravillosa experiencia! ¡Profesores conocedores y personal atento! ¡Creo que este curso era exactamente lo que necesitaba para comenzar mi carrera en desarrollo!
Web Development Full Time Course:
This has been a better experience than I expected. I thought it might be too much information, but it was just the right amount to digest and execute. Wonderful experience! Knowledgeble teachers, consdierate and caring staff! I believe this course was exactly what I needed to start my career in web development!

It was a very good experience. 
I took the web bootcamp in October/November 24. 
I had great teachers, Luis and Dani, who gave me incredible support and helped me cope with the difficulties. 
The bootcamp was a challenge in terms of organization with my personal life and time to study, but there's a whole team that works hard if you need to talk, get advice, etc.
The format is interesting, with a mix of independent work, group work, theory, etc.

A student of Remote Part time May-2024 batch. Intense boot camp with the best instructors. Strongly recommend.
Best regards
Amit Barua
WD PT May24
What started as an uncertainty ended in an experience I would never forget!

I did the AI Engineering Bootcamp remotely.
In general the bootcamp was okay, covered a lot of topics, the teachers were knowledgeable. Definitely not worth the money though.
The quality of the course work was disappointing, requiring the teachers to spend additional time fixing the issues in order to be able to teach. 
One of the teachers regularly missed classes in order to teach somewhere else and no substitute was provided. The teaching assistant was knowledgeable but had no experience in didactics, so even though they were  helpful in assisting with issues, didn’t have much teaching abilities. 
Not enough support was provided for all students.
Seemed like the teachers were lacking support from the school.
Ironhack sells the bootcamp as suitable for both people with no experience in tech as well as experienced programmers, which doesn’t work well in practice.

I am a 36 year old man who studied Fine Arts at University, and always thought of myself as a "right-brained" individual incapable of learning something so complex like coding. You see it was actually my worse weakness when graduating in college. I really can't recall exactly what came onto me to join the AI bootcamp of Ironhack at the beginning, appart from that enormous excitement about what AI was doing to the world and, of course, that personal development I felt I was missing. The fact that I didn't feel like I didn't have an expertise was a daunting thougth. I confess I was so afraid that I wouldn't be able to do it, I doubted myself so much given my brackground, my age, my complete lack of experience in tech. Today, I can safely say that this was the best desicion I made in my entire life. Was it exausting? yes, but it feels like I have solved half of the existencial dreads I had before joining this bootcamp. I don't want to sound too romantic but that is how I am feeling. So really, for those out there that think that is impossible to learn a tech discipline, professionally in 9 weeks, I am the living proof is not, and I got to thank Ironhack for that. Amazing people, amazing teacher and amazing program. I know it can be unbelievable, but these are facts.

I won’t lie, I had low expectations, but my teacher ACTUALLY helped me to stay engaged. I was so anxious at the beginning and thought that the subject wouldn’t be interesting even though I have a background in development, but jaysus he showed me how easy it is to learn. ❤️
Fantastic experience with teachers who follow your progress every step of the way.

Doing the Data Analyst bootcamp at Ironhack has been an incredible experience. It is a very intense course, with a high pace of work, but that was exactly what I was looking for: lots of practice and 100% dedication. The staff is excellent, very committed, and you really create a community with your classmates and professors.
I have learned more in these two intensive months than in other educations I have had that lasted 10 times longer. Ironhack really prepares you to turn your career around, if that's what you're looking for. Of course, you have to be willing to give your all and know that, during the time it lasts, you have to be fully dedicated.
I can only recommend it, it's worth it!

UX Designer, by Ironhack great experice after this 3 Months.
I just said.. Thank you1

I recently complete the data analytics bootcamp in Berlin and the team is very supportive. I had a great experience. The content is very complete and the teacher (Aleks) was the most patient person and explained everything so well.
The teachers and the campus made my experience amazing.

Ironhack's Data Analytics program was instrumental in my career transition from Human Resources to the tech industry. The curriculum was both comprehensive and practical, equipping me with the essential skills needed to excel in data analytics. The hands-on projects and expert guidance provided by the instructors made the learning experience incredibly valuable. Thanks to Ironhack, I successfully pivoted to a tech role and am now thriving in a data-driven environment.

I took the 9-week Web Development bootcamp in the Remote US version. I had a lot of experience as Web Developer before the bootcamp but I thought that the bootcamp helped me get better on certain skills and best practices.
The teaching staff was great and I still keep in touch with some of them after 9 months of completing the bootcamp.
The career staff teach you a lot of valuable techniques for the job hunt that were and are still greatly appreciated.
I’m an Industrial Engineer who wanted to make a career change and, in the end, I wanted Ironhack to be a platform that helped me achieve that and I find it did.
I got hired on around 1.5 months after the bootcamp. I met my employers on a live event hosted by Ironhack post-graduation and that made the difference for me.
The job hunt is always going to be hard and is on each one to make it happen. The bootcamp can assist and Ironhack will assist, but in the end if you make it or not relies on you and how much you want it.
Hope this helps and keep on grinding! 🫶🏽

La experiencia se hizo amena, sobre el corre corre de la información, tanto por el grupo como el por el profesor, Jorge Berrizbeitia es una persona excelente maravillosa, siempre estare agradecido con su apoyo¡
el curso es excelente, yo entre sin conocimiento en programación y ahora soy capaz de hacer una pagina entera.
Honestly, the best decision I have made, doing my bootcamp with Ironhack has been a success.
Buena experiencia, buen profesor y grandes compañeros

UX Designer, by Ironhack great experice after this 3 Months.
I just said.. Thank you1

The career staff teach you a lot of valuable techniques for the job hunt that were and are still greatly appreciated.

I took the Data Analytics bootcamp with Ironhack Puerto Rico and overall I’ve had a positive experience. The content was challenging and I gained a lot of new skills I’ve been able to immediately apply to my career. The teacher and TA were very supportive and knowledgeable. 
Post-bootcamp support from the IronhackPR team has been great, they regularly host events and support in the job search. They regularly check in with alumni and the CareerHack content post-bootcamp has helped me completely revamp my job search and networking strategies. In the month and a half since completing bootcamp I’ve already had more interviews than the entire year previous when I was doing things on my own. 
I’m glad I took the bootcamp and would recommend it.

I recently took the fullstack web development alternative from Ironhack Miami. It was a 9 month intensive bootcamp, ranging from February to April 2024, jam-packed with dedicated and attentive staff, fun laboratories and cool projects. Coming from very little coding experience, now I can fully design, develop, and deploy web apps with the MERN stack. 
The instructors Daniel and Dustin were always there for us, even after work hours to give us advice and help when we "got stuck" coding. These guys really knew their stuff and gladly taught us what they knew.
Honestly, I would completely recommend this bootcamp to anyone. You definitely learn and acquire a whole toolset. I must say, if you want new skills this is a good option. 
Also, to clarify - Ironhack is not a job agency. Finishing the bootcamp does not garantee a job, it is a technical school. They do have career services to provide tools for the jobhunt but it is the individual's responsibility to seek out and apply to opportunities. This disclaimer is important because I've noticed that the other reviews addressed this issue.

Feels like a scam. You pay a lot for something you could get out of a YouTube video for free. They are just selling dreams, not actual value. 
Don't make the mistake I made.

Note: I already had a lot of design experience before undertaking this course, and it was mainly a means of filling in gaps relating specifically to UX design. 
The remote instructor (Neil) was great – very attentive and genuinely cared about our learning, development and success. 
I can see how the course may be challenging and frustrating for someone with no previous design experience. Spending time completing the pre-work and really understanding the tools in advance would help with this.
I would recommend this course for someone looking to boost their existing knowledge in design. If you're new to digital/visual design, you'll need to be ready to really push through and work very hard (including extra hours). 
Also be aware that interpersonal skills are a big part of this course – you'll be working almost exclusively in teams (in groups of 2, or up to 5 people), so being patient and understanding, humble and openminded is a huge part of this.
The course was funded by the Berlin job centre for me, so I didn't have to pay anything myself.

UX/UI Remote instructor not only had limited experience working in the United States but gave us TERRIBLE advice about the amount of money we should expect to make and how we "shouldn't waste our time with internships". What????? 
Not only was this lady in a different timezone showing up half asleep yawning and apologizing for being so tired after teaching 2 other cohorts (what am I supposed to say that??) but from time to time would even teach/review our work from a hotel bar. I paid $12,000 for this bootcamp and my instructor barely spent any time enforcing best practices as a designer. The curriculum was outdated and the "live teaching" was not worth the price tag. 
I basically had to beg her to give me constructive feedback as everything was fine with her. I received 3 "job opportunities" to apply for which did NOT land in an interview despite applying to all. When I did my research to see who the companies hired they (not surprising!) hired experienced designers. When I asked about why I hadn't received any more job opportunities to apply for they ghosted me. 
DO NOT enroll in the Remote US track. I should've known this Miami people were going to scam me.

I did a UX/UI Design Bootcamp at Ironhack. It lasted for 6 months, part-time. It was intense and I learned a lot of new stuff and made invaluable connections. The best part was we got to do a lot of hands-on practice and projects instead of just listening to lectures.

Absolute scam... Paid for this in full, they recommended 1 job, that was on site, in a different state, on the other side of the country. Not worth a single penny, absolute ripoff.... RUN AWAY, find a accredited institution instead.

This company should stop with their false promising ad's on Instagram telling people they can get a job easily after the Bootcamp!!
The Bootcamp itself was very very though but you learn a lot; the career hack service is just trash! 
I was lucky to get into the programm with the Bildungsgutschein in Germany; that means the goverment payed for the bootcamp with the intention to help me to find a job faster. 
I'm a Junior Graphic Designer and graduated 6months ago. I applied for 190jobs and did one volunteering project for 2months and a freelancing part-time job for 43hours. I only had 2 interviews in that time and both of them had nothing to do with UX/UI.
I feel like I completely wasted my time with the bootcamp.
The reality is that atm the UX/UI market is completely oversaturrated, and Ironhack keep sending students out to the market keeping them from the reality. Everything is sunshine and roses and after the bootcamp the hard reality hits your face! 
If you decide to do the bootcamp, get yourself a personal Mentor or Coach who helps you to find a job and be aware about the current situation on the job market r.n! 
If you are from a completely different field don't fall for the rainbow posts on Instagram!! 
And yes I'm still unemployed!

It´s interesting how there are mostly 1 star experiences and the word scam being used in reviews and a sudden wave of 5 star reviews is following ... nothing in between. (maybe mployees will now post 4 star reviews)
Ironhack are in my view omitting information to get you to sign up. UX/UI design course teachers had no relevant work experience. So called career week was the biggest scam. Many in our course have been complaining only to be gaslighted about it.
You are expected to work for course way more then 8 hours a day though and get extensive tasks over weekend. Not sure what the point of this is.

Total scam. Any education and new skills resulted from my own external mentors and resources. Avoid and do not become a victim like me. My computer eroded during the course and there are zero educators.

I’m about to sign up for ironhack hopefully I get the best out of it and not regret the decision. Cause I haven’t come across any good review online even alumni that graduated few months ago didn’t recommend Ironhack . I’m not rich to throw away €8500

Company is a scam. Charge around 8k for a course but after course had complete, you are on your own. Career team ignores emails on purpose. The whole company is a fraudulent from the teachers to the higher management. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone unless your rich and don’t care about the money go ahead

I recently finished a UX/UI bootcamp by Ironhack. The only extravagant thing about the bootcamp is the price tag.
The bootcamp DOES NOT prepare you for the work of a UX Designer - in fact only after the bootcamp, through tedious self-study I was able to learn basic things such as autolayout in Figma.
The career services are an absolute joke - the career week is nothing but a waste of time, and the coaches are not really specialised in their respective fields. It does not help me to have a career coach, who does not know what to look for in a portfolio, or who does not know that Figma-pdfs are not ATS-friendly.
For this valuable information I had to turn to ADP-list coaches.
Thinking about the structure of the company it is no wonder. Ironhack primarily seems to hire past students as teaching- and learning assistants. I don't mean experienced UX designers who want to give back, but people who apart from the bootcamp have no experience whatsoever in the field.
Not only wouldn't I recommend you to attend the bootcamp, I would actively recommend to look for a different one. There are many options on the market, with better structure, better prices, and better networking opportunities. 
I genuinely regret paying for this.

While the teaching staff did their best, the company over-hyped the possibilities of getting hired after the conclusion of your bootcamp. While they do make it clear that a job is not guaranteed, at the same time they say that most of their students find a job within 3-6 months if you follow their guidance. As an outsider to the tech world, I placed my trust in Ironhack and gave them my hard earned money / little free time.
Unfortunately, the reality is not what they make it out to be. Out of a class of approx. 20 students, only a few have found a job (and these had previous coding experience). The rest of us are barely getting any interviews whatsoever. All in all, you will pay 7.5k for something you can learn for free on YT and other free platforms. 
This feels like a legal scam.

I applied for the Data Analytics program in Mexico. The project manager bullied me to withdraw my application and ask for a reimbursement. Even though the program was advertised as a course for beginners, I was told I won’t get the credential because I am a beginner, so I should withdraw my application even before the course started. I told them I would study hard they told me it doesn’t matter. I was told the reimbursement would take max 60 days. Today they told me I might not even get my money back within 60 days. I am on day 35. I don't post negative reviews, but I don't know what else to do to help myself. I lost my job 3 months ago and this was supposed to be a new beginning, instead it is everything but that.

I share the same experience with the last reviews below, they just here for your money! I had a horrible experience, the teacher from Serbia miss S.D was Horrible to me, yelled at some of her non favorite students. I basically had no support and learned everything alone. And talking about follow ups with the career hack let me laugh they don't help you at all ! It's been over a quite some time now since I graduated and apparently I was one of the best students ( from what they saying) well let me tell you if u do a reconversion and you over 40yo it is a struggle to get a junior position anywhere! A waste of 8000€, waste of time, I felt bullied and humiliated... they don't teach they read slides! If the teacher and her team don't like you well guess what you pay the hard price! I am very very disappointed... runaway they just want to take your money and they not willing to do any good! If u are 20 ish max 30 yo you might get a chance but most of the one of my age we struggle and never found jobs in the industry ! I have to restart all over my reconversion
I've just began my application process at ironhack London bootcamp, and am having a wonderful experience already. great support from the Team

Do yourself a favor and don't go to this bootcamp. Terrible material, they have this online platform with what is supposed to be an addition to what you learn in class with information that could be easily found on the internet with an even more in-depth explanation. The staff is awful, it takes very long to answer emails and if you communicate an issue to them they are in my experience, extremely condescending. The teacher that led the online course was very unprepared, the lesson consisted mainly of him talking and using slideshows it wasn't interactive at all, and the teacher's English level and technical level was, in my opinion, not adequate enough to teach. The only good thing is that they provide you with exercise martial, but you could access very similar coding exercises through online katas. They don't provide any specific help with careers and I know many of the people that did the Bootcamp had difficulty finding a job, just have a look on Linkedin.

I am really disappointed. I asked for info and an interview (Bordeaux Ironhack bootcamp) and they gave me the appointment after 2 weeks, then changed 4 times the appointment. The day of appointment I thought that as all bootcamps send you a link for interview but they just called me by phone with 1 hour and 30 late. Sorry but I prefer more serious bootcamp.
An incredible experience. An innovative and unique learning method. I highly recommend it.
Very satisfied with Le Wagon's Data Science and AI bootcamp. The professors have technical and pedagogical skills. I learned a lot during these 6 weeks.

My experience was really I was able to learn many new things that I didn't know anything about and I found that great. And I was able to gain a lot of experience to know how to code for myself or for a futur job. And everyone was really friendly and super.
Very good supervision, quality teaching, exceptional support before, during and after the training, there is a before and after training at the wagon, thank you.
They are efficient and practical
Le Wagon's program is very well done. Teachers are great. I would totally recommend it.

Making you like coding in 9 weeks, it is a challenge that Le Wagon just realised for me. 
The teachers and the teams surrounding them are really invested in making you like and understand coding. 
You will need to be invested and keep practicing but it is a very good way to start your programming carreer.
Nice option to start to learn how to code, totally recommend it :)

9 intense weeks with a surprisingly high technical level — I was genuinely impressed!
The teaching staff was great, the courses were well structured, and the buddy system was incredible.
The final project phase was both challenging and rewarding.

Joining Le Wagon was one of the best decisions I've ever made. The bootcamp is intense but incredibly rewarding. I went in with very little technical knowledge, and after just a few weeks, I was building full web applications.
The curriculum is well-structured, the teaching staff is passionate and supportive, and the community is amazing. I especially appreciated the collaborative spirit and the practical, hands-on approach to learning.
Thanks to Le Wagon, I’ve discovered a true passion for coding and a clear direction for my career. Highly recommended for anyone looking to change paths or level up their tech skills.

I did the Data Analytics bootcamp, 9-weeks full-time, on-site. Awesome experience. I had zero knowledge in data, and feel totally confident today applying for data roles. Great achievement. I enjoyed it very much.

Top-notch training! The courses are clear, comprehensive, and taught by highly skilled instructors. Beyond the educational aspect, Le Wagon also creates opportunities to unwind with activities and events, allowing us to connect with fellow students across different batches.
For anyone still on the fence, I can only encourage you to take the leap. You won’t regret it if web development excites you. You'll walk away with great connections, stronger technical skills, and the resilience to tackle any challenge in your future career.
Good course with large range of themes and varried trainers.

everything is so smooth, a good mix between one to one interactions and automated processes! and still this fantastic way of learning micing frienship, challenges, digital but in persons and such a great ambition about what we should learn
The teachers (big up Fred), the community and the "lifestyle" (i mean, we're all in during 2 month) made this bootcamp . Fortunately, because it's a tough one.

I had an amazing experience! I absolutely loved the hands-on approach during the online sessions, where we worked on practical exercises. It was a great opportunity to learn from other students and foster true collaboration.
I really appreciated having to prepare for the class in advance—it made the sessions more engaging and productive. The training exceeded my expectations in every way. The program was well-designed and perfectly suited to the time available.
This experience has inspired me to dive deeper into Machine Learning. I now have a solid grasp of the basics and the tools to explore further, which was my initial goal.
The instructors were always available and provided excellent guidance throughout the sessions as well as during the final project. The staff was responsive and supportive.
A fantastic experience that I hope to repeat as soon as possible! 😊
Formation très qualitative, je recommande sincèrement.
Great program of formation
A great school that provides its students with a wide range of tools and constantly strives to help them progress. Incredible atmosphere and I've been able to see that I've made a lot of progress.

9 intense weeks with a surprisingly high technical level — I was genuinely impressed!
The teaching staff was great, the courses were well structured, and the buddy system was incredible.
The final project phase was both challenging and rewarding.

Joining Le Wagon was one of the best decisions I've ever made. The bootcamp is intense but incredibly rewarding. I went in with very little technical knowledge, and after just a few weeks, I was building full web applications.
The curriculum is well-structured, the teaching staff is passionate and supportive, and the community is amazing. I especially appreciated the collaborative spirit and the practical, hands-on approach to learning.
Thanks to Le Wagon, I’ve discovered a true passion for coding and a clear direction for my career. Highly recommended for anyone looking to change paths or level up their tech skills.

Formation solide et complete
Accompagnants de qualité et géniaux.
Great experience !
10/10 !

Je ne m'attendais pas à ce que les 9 semaines de bootcamp soient si intenses et surtout, à apprendre autant de choses.
Le programme est complet, aborde séquentiellement et logiquement tous les concepts du dev fullstack, en implémentant chaque nouveauté dans les concepts vus précédemment.
En plus de ça, le service carrière offert est top, et les afterworks et événements organisés permettent de sociabiliser très facilement avec tous les étudiants

I did the Data Analytics bootcamp, 9-weeks full-time, on-site. Awesome experience. I had zero knowledge in data, and feel totally confident today applying for data roles. Great achievement. I enjoyed it very much.
Une agréable expérience, des rencontres inoubliables!

Top-notch training! The courses are clear, comprehensive, and taught by highly skilled instructors. Beyond the educational aspect, Le Wagon also creates opportunities to unwind with activities and events, allowing us to connect with fellow students across different batches.
For anyone still on the fence, I can only encourage you to take the leap. You won’t regret it if web development excites you. You'll walk away with great connections, stronger technical skills, and the resilience to tackle any challenge in your future career.

J'ai vraiment apprécié mon expérience au Wagon, que ce soit avec les autres élèves, les professeurs ou les TAs. L'ambiance était géniale, et j'ai particulièrement aimé la liberté de travailler tout en étant guidé. L'immersion dans le travail était top, avec des exercices en duo et, par-dessus tout, le projet sur lequel j'ai travaillé. Le secteur vivant autour du Wagon a aussi été un véritable point fort. Si je devais mentionner un petit bémol, ce serait que les cours du matin étaient parfois un peu trop rapides, ce qui m'empêchait d'assimiler pleinement certaines notions. À part ça, c'était vraiment le top du top !

Enseignement basé sur environ 2h de cours 'magistral' en visio le matin suivies d'exercices le reste de la journée avec l'assistance de 2 "teacher assistants".
On travaille chaque jour en binôme avec un autre étudiant.
Les journées sont intenses de 9h à 18h;).
Les cours et les exercices sont très bien faits. 
Pour ceux - comme moi - qui n'avaient pas d'expérience en sql, python et en outils API avant de commencer les cours de data analyst du Wagon, je recommande de lire et écouter les cours la veille au soir, pour être rassuré et plus à l'aise le lendemain.

La formation en elle même est très intéressante, et peut être un bon moyen pour les personnes qui souhaitent faire des études en développement web ou celles qui veulent faire leur site web de se lancer. En revanche, si vous souhaitez vous reconvertir, cette formation courte ne vous permettra pas de le faire. Après avoir obtenu le diplôme et 1 an de recherche d’emploi, même constat pour moi et d’autres personnes de mon batch - ils vous vendent la possibilité de changer de métier mais aucune entreprise ne recrute des dev avec ce genre de diplôme.

Le bootcamp Online Webflow du Wagon est une expérience ultra enrichissante ! 🚀 La formation est claire, bien structurée et très pratique. Les formateurs sont pédagogues et disponibles, et le programme permet de maîtriser Webflow rapidement grâce à des projets concrets.
✅ Contenu complet et progressif
✅ Excellente pédagogie et accompagnement
✅ Apprentissage efficace et directement applicable
💡 Je recommande à 100% pour ceux qui veulent créer des sites pros avec Webflow ! 🎉
Good course with large range of themes and varried trainers.

everything is so smooth, a good mix between one to one interactions and automated processes! and still this fantastic way of learning micing frienship, challenges, digital but in persons and such a great ambition about what we should learn

Nunca llegaron a contestar. 
Me extrañaba ver que solo tenía críticas positivas, en todas las plataformas, teniendo aulas en todo el mundo y desde hace mucho tiempo (por estadística tiene que haber al menos una persona a la que no le ha funcionado bien). En mi caso, lo han confirmado con la atención al cliente antes de si quiera inscribirme. Me dejaron esperando en la cita para solicitar más información sin ningún tipo de aviso previo, y reagendaron la cita anterior sin aviso previo también.
Si este es el trato antes de contratar el servicio (un servicio muy caro por lo que tengo entendido), no sé cómo será la atención al cliente una vez se ha pagado.
The teachers (big up Fred), the community and the "lifestyle" (i mean, we're all in during 2 month) made this bootcamp . Fortunately, because it's a tough one.

I had an amazing experience! I absolutely loved the hands-on approach during the online sessions, where we worked on practical exercises. It was a great opportunity to learn from other students and foster true collaboration.
I really appreciated having to prepare for the class in advance—it made the sessions more engaging and productive. The training exceeded my expectations in every way. The program was well-designed and perfectly suited to the time available.
This experience has inspired me to dive deeper into Machine Learning. I now have a solid grasp of the basics and the tools to explore further, which was my initial goal.
The instructors were always available and provided excellent guidance throughout the sessions as well as during the final project. The staff was responsive and supportive.
A fantastic experience that I hope to repeat as soon as possible! 😊
une expérience vraiment hors du commun
Formation très qualitative, je recommande sincèrement.
Great program of formation
Excellent bootcamp, good organisation, great teachers, good method. I recomend it to everyone

Le Wagon a été une expérience intense et enrichissante ! J’ai acquis des compétences solides en Python, SQL et Power BI grâce à des projets concrets et un excellent encadrement. L’ambiance collaborative et le soutien de la communauté sont un vrai plus. Je recommande vivement ce bootcamp à toute personne motivée !
La méthodologie Le Wagon, où l'apprentissage se fait en groupe et entre pairs, m'a permis de renforcer mes connaissances et m'a facilité la compréhension du code.
A great school that provides its students with a wide range of tools and constantly strives to help them progress. Incredible atmosphere and I've been able to see that I've made a lot of progress.

Ce que j'ai beaucoup apprécié durant cette formation, ce sont les parties pratiques. Il y avait très peu de théorie, ce qui laissait un maximum de temps à la pratique. Les cours théoriques en début de journée permettaient de cerner les problèmes à aborder et de savoir comment les résoudre. Leur durée était parfaite ! Le nombre d'étudiants était idéal (nous étions 8), ce qui facilitait les échanges entre étudiants et avec le professeur. Rapidement, notre groupe est devenu très soudé.
Si je devais résumer mon parcours en un mot, ce serait productif ! La formation était intense, et les 9 semaines sont passées à toute vitesse, mais cela en valait vraiment la peine. J'ai passé de très bons moments chez Le Wagon, et je ne peux que recommander la formation de data analyst en présentiel et faire confiance à leur programme.
Aujourd'hui, je me sens prêt à débuter une carrière de data analyst.

La formation Data Analytics était vraiment qualitative.
Je ne connaissais rien au code ou à SQL en arrivant et maintenant ce sont des choses que je maîtrise donc franchement rien à redire sur la qualité de l'enseignement. Sur 2 mois il y a énormément de choses à apprendre donc la formation est très dense, mais c'est vraiment très formateur car beaucoup d'exercices pratiques.
Très bonne expérience, beaucoup de compétences acquises et l'equipe pédagogique est très compétente. Petit bémol concernant les locaux

L’expérience du wagon a été incroyable de part ses professeurs supers pro et pédagogues, un programme vraiment bien conçu pour nous faire progresser rapidement. Et tout le côté communautaire comme les afterworks qui permettent de créer un lien et une proximité entre étudiants/professeurs/allumnis

In retrospect I would say that a lot of efforts were spent in designing the intellectual content of the bootcamp and the way it is delivered and it shows. I felt like I was supported all the time and staff were there to help. Spending time with my colleagues, which came from so many different backgrounds was magic. On the negative side, the physical facilities(building, isolation, internet, etc) could be improved.
Started coding from scratch and earned my diploma in just two months! A high-quality program with passionate teachers and an incredibly positive mindset. Thank you, Le Wagon!

Très grande étendue du domaine couvert. Une abondante documentation fournie. Des mises en situation quasi permanente sous la orme de challenges à remplir tous les jours. Des professeurs spécialistes du domaine enseigné aidés par des assistants expérimentés et disponibles. Une bonne préparation à la recherce d'un emploi.

C'est une expérience très bien pensée en termes de pédagogie. Classe tous les matins de 9h à 10h30, ensuite exercices pratiques; TB d'avoir un rythme organisé et régulier pendant 9 semaines. 
TB d'avoir un buddy différent chaque jour : cela permet de parler à tout le monde. Les rappels réguliers sur chaque outil en cours de route: super pour se remettre à l'esprit des connaissances. Seamless experience : tout est pensé, organisé pour que l'acquisition des skills soit efficace : TA à disposition, messagerie slack pour dialoguer avec tout le personnel, notion etcDes profs tous supers, motivés et motivants !
J'ai suivi le Batch Data Analytics chez le Wagon Lille en fin 2024. Ce fut une belle expérience au vu de la quantité de connaissance acquise en si peu de temps. Je recommande.

C'est une formation très qualitative mais il faut être prêt à s'accrocher pendant deux mois car c'est énormément de contenu. Mais c'est extrêmement formateur, et j'ai encore du mal à imaginer ma situation il y a deux mois avant d'apprendre toutes ces choses!

I had such an amazing experience!
Some advice for future students:
- Make sure you really know why you want to do a bootcamp.
- It is challenging, especially when your background is not from tech to begin with
- However, everything is achievable if you put your mind to it and trust the process. You'll be amazed to see so many people suddenly finding their way through it and succeeding!
In addition, I highly advise future students to manage their personal time outside: sleep, sleep and sleep when you can (and do your flashcards). It will help you greatly when things get harder for you.
And finally, the experience at Le Wagon is also what you decide to make of it. I've met amazing people all the way, even from other batches in Analytics or Data Science.
Go to all events, all afterworks and create your own events with your batch. 
Staying solo is not a viable option and connecting with as many people you can will make the experience way more worthwhile. 
Thanks Le Wagon and good luck to all future students!

J'ai participé au Bootcamp Data Science Paris d'octobre 2024. Mon évolution technique en 2 mois est énorme. Très bonne apprentissage mais attention, aujourd'hui il ne vous garantie plus rien.
Le langage appris est de moins en moins utilisé. L'employabilité d'un web dev junior est quasi nulle.
C'est une petite porte vers plus de formation mais qui a très peu de valeur (ou pas du tout) sur le marché professionnel.

Honestly, I quite liked the course and I think it's a was a good introduction to many frameworks. I did hate all the emojis and the words of encouragement saying you're now a "machine learning engineer" or a "Data Scientist", because let's face it, you're not. 
If you have 7k to spend, and just want to learn some cool stuff, go for it. If you're looking to "change your life, break into tech", think again. This isn't the 2021 job market, you can check out the CS or Bootcamp subreddits. My recommendation would be to do some self-study and enroll in a legit MSCS program (e.g. OMSCS), although it's still going to be hard for you to find a job in this market.

Déjà que j'ai galéré à contacter le Wagon je me retrouve ensuite 1 semaine après ma première demande avec une conseillère arrogante qui ne prend pas le temps de vous expliquer et vous fait des remarques pour vous montrer votre stupidité quand on a une question...
Pour une formation bien plus chère que ses concurrents on peut s'attendre à au moins plus de qualités avec de bons conseillers mais même pas !

LeWagon London - How to waste thousands of pounds and be left with no job and poor mental health! 🥾🏕️🤑😥🤯 Update as of November 2024 - they essentially blocked various emails and their ‘legal’ team, threatened me (the irony). I will continue to tell everyone about my experience here, and what a complete and utter waste of time and money it was. 
Having actually completed the full time Web Dev course at Le Wagon London in March of 2023 (Jan-March), I can tell you for a fact that it’s not all it might appear from the outside and certainly a number of things are not right. 
Let’s start with the implications and stats - the reason I did this bootcamp was to aid in a career change. They strongly imply that once you’ve done the bootcamp there’s thousands of tech jobs and that you will be highly employable, unfortunately this is just not the case for the vast majority of people who will leave a Le Wagon bootcamp. They use a Stat of 93% employment rate, which as of today seems to have dropped to 90%, yet still I would be amazed if the inverse of this figure was true and that even 10% of students got a tech job because of the bootcamp. 
I am awaiting a FOI request about what data they use to come up with these stats. 
If these stats were true, surely most of the people I did the bootcamp would be employed. I would say less than 10% of them have a job that isn’t either with Le Wagon or that have nothing to do with competing a coding bootcamp! 
The content of what is taught and how it’s taught is not good, from focusing on Ruby/Rails, something that’s hardly at the forefront of the tech world in 2023 or at the top of an employers wish list. Then there is the inexperienced staff who have little or no teaching experience and the first time they’ve done anything like this is when they’re offered a job by Le Wagon straight from the bootcamp as what they call a TA (teaching assistant). This is how they’re able to keep their costs down, and how the whole thing is able to keep going, one cohort at a time. 
The lack of attention to any front end design coding or real emphasis on anything that wasn’t Ruby was astonishing. You question this as you’re there, as do other students and you’re all told the same, that it will all come together in the final week - you’re suspicious but tell yourself they’re a big company, it will be ok…. It won’t. Trust your gut! 
The ‘career week’ was like the icing on top of a really stale cake, and just an absolute farce. Not only did the 3 employers who were invited not have any jobs to offer, and were not actually recruiting, two of them didn’t seem to know why they were there. When their talks about the tech industry finished, we were instructed to talk to them, like some oddball fans, it was almost like we all gathered round to see what other pearls of wisdom they would offer. They didn’t. 
All in all, 9 weeks later and not much wiser, I would say they had well and truly done a number on me.
Almost two years later, and I am a still not in a tech role, and my physical and mental health has suffered considerably, something which is particularly saddening, given that Le Wagon continues to pedal their bootcamps to anyone who is silly enough to believe their nonsense.

Mon expérience au Wagon a été agréable pour plusieurs raisons. Tout d'abord, la qualité des formateurs est exceptionnelle ; ils sont non seulement experts dans leur domaine, mais aussi très accessibles et prêts à aider. L'interaction entre les élèves favorise un environnement d'apprentissage collaboratif, ce qui rend les cours encore plus enrichissants.
De plus, le programme est bien structuré, ce qui permet d'aborder les sujets de manière progressive et logique. Les projets pratiques nous permettent d'appliquer immédiatement ce que nous apprenons, renforçant ainsi notre compréhension.
Enfin, l'accent mis sur le networking et l'intégration dans la communauté est un véritable atout. Les événements et les rencontres avec des anciens élèves ouvrent des portes et créent des opportunités.
Pour améliorer encore l'expérience, il serait bénéfique d'ajouter davantage de ressources post-formation pour aider les anciens élèves à rester à jour sur les nouvelles tendances et technologies.
Dans l'ensemble, le Wagon fait un excellent travail pour préparer ses élèves à réussir dans le monde du développement et du design !

TLDR - Do not recommend Data Engineering bootcamp
Region: Europe
Format: Part time, fully remote
Personal circumstance: full time employee at global Big Tech company
Having attended Le Wagon's Data Science bootcamp in 2022, I was very excited when the Data Engineering bootcamp, which was intended for more advanced and experienced engineers, became available. The key reasons why the bootcamp was so woeful can be summarised as follows:
Cons:
1. The course material was very low quality - 50% of the course was poorly written, contained errors and sometimes did not make sense. Many exercises were open source tutorials that were basically copied and pasted and used as 'course material'
2. Around 70% of the teachers were unqualified to teach, had no to little work experience and had poor knowledge of the teaching material
3. Over 50% of my cohort was complete beginners and was not qualified to attend the bootcamp. The bootcamp was advertised as being an 'advanced' course. This was a major impediment to my personal learning as a midlevel, working engineer, as the peer coding and the final project did not work out. This was because some individuals either had no idea what they were doing and/ or behaved very disruptively. To illustrate with some examples, many people did not know how to use github (or understand the importance of version control). Some people could not follow basic instructions or act with simple professional etiquette e.g. interrupting the person speaking during a stand up meeting, attending class in a public cafe and not being able to get their audio working, and asking to meet during work hours impromptu so I could not join (half of my project team members were unemployed)
Pro
1. The syllabus was comprehensive and well curated. It acted as a good introductory 'map' to the Data Engineering domain
2. The 3 good teachers were very good, but they were very thinly stretched as the others were ineffective
I was extremely disappointed with the bootcamp and felt it was not worth the 6000GBP price tag. To be transparent, I left 2 weeks prior to the end of the bootcamp because of work commitments and also my group project was an utter disaster and was not conducive to my learning. A result of this was that I did not get the certificate of completion, which was ok to me because I intended to omit this from my CV/ resume, as I did not want to associate professionally with this poor quality bootcamp.
I had made several complaints during the bootcamp, but sadly they were not addressed. I had messaged the product manager directly to set up a meeting to discuss my feedback, but this did not materialise. Perhaps a public bad review on trust pilot would prompt from action from Le Wagon
To summarise, please avoid and save your hard earned cash

Une formation complète et au top, des teachers compétents/tes et bienveillants/tes.
Je suis ravi de mon investissement en temps et en argent et je suis honoré de faire dorénavant partie à vie des alumnis de Le Wagon :) !

Mon étoile est destinée à tous les profs que nous avons eu la chance d'avoir sur notre promo. Ils sont bien les seuls à mériter cette dernière. C'est clairement le seul bon souvenir que je garde de cette expérience. N'y mettez pas les pieds si vous n'avez pas de base ET qu'il vous faut un peu de temps pour assimiler les notions. Certain.e.s ont eu la chance de venir d'un domaine tout autre et d'apprécier. Certain.e.s avaient aussi déjà une connaissance en programmation. Personnellement, c'était loin d'être mon cas et j'en suis sortie plus brisée qu'autre chose (et je ne suis malheureusement pas la seule). 
On m'a vendu une formation avec un taux de réussite incroyable, mais c'était avant de savoir que la plupart des élèves sortant se mettent en freelance, forcément les statistiques sont biaisées. Mise à part l'apprentissage du Ruby qui est totalement obsolète aujourd'hui, l'expérience acquise n'est pas assez pour espérer entrer dans une entreprise à la suite du Wagon. On nous l'a très clairement exprimé. Quand on demande conseil de quoi faire, vers où aller après la formation, on m'a conseillé une école qui n'était pas du tout dans mes envies ni mes compétences, parce que: partenariat. Heureusement cette formation ne m'a pas servie à rien, mais m'a permis de mieux me vendre pour une rentrée dans une autre école (qui a d'ailleurs été bien démontée de la part d'un.e gérant.e en disant que le Wagon était bien mieux.... Vous voyez le genre...)
Au vu de la somme excessive de la formation pour la qualité, je vous conseille de bien vous préparer ou de prendre plusieurs témoignages avant de penser à y entrer. Ce n'est, après tout que mon ressenti et les avis peuvent être partagés.

L'expérience globale de la formation au Wagon a été très satisfaisante pour moi. En âge de la retraite, mon objectif était de me familiariser avec le métier de data scientist afin de créer une activité dans ce domaine. La formation a non seulement répondu à mes attentes, mais les a souvent dépassées par la qualité et la rigueur du programme. Les instructeurs, ainsi que le personnel, ont grandement contribué à ma réussite grâce à leur présence et leur soutien constants.
La formation au Wagon est intense, surtout au début. En deux mois, j'ai acquis une vision généraliste du métier de data scientist, bien que cela ne suffise pas pour devenir expert.
Un aspect particulièrement enrichissant du bootcamp est la création de liens précieux avec les autres participants et les anciens élèves. Cette communauté représente une opportunité pour le networking et le partage de connaissances.
En conclusion, je recommande vivement ce bootcamp à toute personne cherchant à enrichir ses connaissances en data science. Bravo pour la formation, Le Wagon !

I loved the teaching process, wich is very structured, with the lectures in the morning, the challenges for the rest of the day and finally the recap/live code at the end of the day. And of course the teachers and TAs which were very knowledgeable and available for helping with the challenges, taking the time to explain new concepts on 1 to 1 if needed, and they always had an answer, it was really rare to hear them answer ''I don't know". Finally, I enjoyed the life on campus, always good coffee and good tea available, premises always nice and clean, nice chill areas for lunch time and all the afterwork parties, which were always well organized and good for the team spirit. 
My experience at Le Wagon has been extremely positive, I enjoyed it even more than expected and I now feel strong and confident in my career transitioning to the data world. I enjoyed going back to school, I enjoyed the intensity of the teaching process, I enjoyed also sharing this bootcamp with very diverse classmates with a high intellectual level and I enjoyed the social side.

I enrolled in Le Wagon's bootcamp with high expectations based on their advertising and the promises made during the interview. Unfortunately, my experience has been deeply disappointing and frustrating. The course does not match what was advertised or what was presented during the interview. Given these issues, I decided to withdraw after 10 days in the bootcamp and requested a refund. Despite numerous requests, my refund has been ignored.
I also want to highlight that according to their contract, they refuse to refund the tuition fee unless there is a case of force majeure, which does not address the issue of false advertising. This is a breach of contract on their part.
Be careful how you spend £7,400. Do not waste it. Find a credible bootcamp provider. I am now considering further action, including legal avenues, to resolve this matter.
Overall, I am extremely disappointed with Le Wagon and would not recommend it to anyone, especially UK-based students. The course failed to meet expectations in every aspect, from support to course structure.

I enrolled in Le Wagon's bootcamp with high expectations based on their advertising and the promises made during the interview. Unfortunately, my experience has been deeply disappointing and frustrating. Here are the key issues I encountered:
Insufficient Support: The course offers inadequate support for students. Despite my best efforts, the lack of guidance and assistance made it challenging to understand the concepts.
Short Lecture Duration: The lectures, lasting only 2.5 hours per day, are insufficient to cover complex subjects like SQL, Pandas, Numpy, and others. This limited duration hinders comprehensive learning and practice, making it difficult to keep up with the course material.
Inadequate Interaction: One of the instructors,  instructed students not to ask questions during lectures and to use the chat instead. This approach limited real-time interaction and impeded immediate clarification of doubts, further complicating the learning process.
Lack of Engagement in Breakout Rooms: Students were not engaging in breakout rooms, leaving everyone to struggle individually with challenges. Additionally, inadequate translations from French to English further complicated understanding.
Geographical Discrepancy: None of the students were based in the UK, with the majority being in Berlin.If I had known the course was not designed for UK students, I would not have enrolled.
Unsatisfactory Response from Batch Manager: When I raised my concerns on Slack on May 30th, my batch manager advised me to seek information myself rather than relying on support. This response left me feeling unsupported and frustrated.
Complaints from Other Students: A couple of students also complained about the pace of certain subjects, indicating that my concerns were not isolated.
The course does not match what was advertised or what was presented during the interview. Given these issues, I decided to withdraw after 10 days in the bootcamp and requested a refund. Despite numerous requests, my refund has been ignored.
I also want to highlight that according to their contract, they refuse to refund the tuition fee unless there is a case of force majeure, which does not address the issue of false advertising. This is a breach of contract on their part.
Be careful how you spend £7,400. Do not waste it. Find a credible bootcamp provider. I am now considering further action, including legal avenues, to resolve this matter.
Overall, I am extremely disappointed with Le Wagon and would not recommend it to anyone, especially UK-based students. The course failed to meet expectations in every aspect, from support to course structure.

I recently completed a course at Le Wagon, and I must say, it was not worth the £7,000 investment. Despite the high expectations set by the program, I found myself needing to take additional courses after the Bootcamp to be job-ready.
Le Wagon claimed that 90% of our batch would land jobs post-Bootcamp, but in reality, it was less than 10%. This discrepancy was incredibly disappointing and misleading.
Another major drawback was the involvement of Stepex in the funding process. They constantly wanted to look into my bank account, which felt invasive and added unnecessary stress to the experience.
While the tutors were friendly and approachable, the content they taught was insufficient. I quickly realized I needed to learn additional programming languages beyond what was covered in the course to be competitive in the job market.
In summary, the course did not live up to its promises or justify the hefty price tag. I would advise potential students to consider other options and be prepared for additional learning and expenses beyond the Bootcamp.

Vous ne serez pas employable rapidement après cette formation, le wagon vend un peu trop de rêve à ce sujet car le marché était très en demande il y'a quelques années et leur formation suffisait mais ce n'est plus le cas.
Cependant la pédagogie de cette formation est exceptionnelle et donne de bonnes bases pour approfondir le sujet et savoir pour de bon si on veut vraiment devenir développeur ou non. 
Pour le reste il faut travailler encore plus dur car le marché commence à être sacrement bouché, la faute à toutes ces formations en lignes qui vendent du rêve + l'explosion de l'IA qui rend les dev "juniors" moins utiles.

Intense Web Development Bootcamp of 9 weeks. A very positive and fulfilling experience, learning Ruby, JavaScript, HTML and CSS as well as concepts like MVC architecure or Object Oriented Programming. 
The course format starts with a 90-minute course delivered by one of the teachers and for the rest day we practice on the concepts we saw in the morning by doing different exercises, each one with an increasing level of difficulty. 
Tutors are present throughout the day to help you when you have questions or when you are blocked in an exercise. The format is very intense and sometimes we have the impression that we have not had enough time to assimilate the concepts, but I totally recommended it for those who like a challenge. The two final projects helped me build a lot of confidence around my abilities as a web developer.
Overall, the experience was great as was the ambiance in the class every day. What I appreciated the most about Le Wagon is that they have built a community and they make you feel part of the community from the beginning. The events organized by the school are also fun, especially the laser game.
Intense, we discovered a lot of differents topics in Data Science !

LE WAGON: A HARROWING EXPERIENCE AND A TRUE NIGHTMARE
My journey with Le Wagon has been SO DISAPPOINTING that I feel the OBLIGATION to share my experience to prevent others from falling into the same trap. The SHOCKING news of the CANCELLATION of the bootcamp just five days before its scheduled start, due to only having two participants, marked the beginning of a series of OVERWHELMING problems.
During the registration process, I found myself dealing with MORE THAN SIX INDIVIDUALS, and to make matters worse, I had to REPEAT the application process two or three times. The INEFFICIENCY of their communication system between the branches in Spain and Germany is UNACCEPTABLE and has added an extra layer of FRUSTRATION.
In my struggle to obtain the GOVERNMENT VOUCHER, I faced more obstacles. The agent expressed DOUBTS about the RELIABILITY of Le Wagon, which only HEIGHTENED MY CONCERNS. The POSITIVE REVIEWS on their website do not reveal the DARK REALITY of the issues Le Wagon is facing. The LACK OF PROFESSIONALISM is evident, with people DISAPPEARING overnight, supposedly in "VACATION MODE." Additionally, they CHANGED the sales representative repeatedly during my process, causing CONFUSION and DISTRUST.
To add INSULT TO INJURY, the Data Analyst course, which costs a STAGGERING 8500 EUROS, left me QUESTIONING ITS VALUE. After READING and CONTACTING former students, it became apparent that completing the course doesn't necessarily leave you as prepared as you might believe. Moreover, the ACTUAL EMPLOYMENT RATE is not accurately reflected on the website, as the INTERVIEWER candidly revealed that many students either LEAVE the course or pursue it for PERSONAL ENRICHMENT rather than seeking employment in the field.
I made the PAINFUL DECISION not to continue with Le Wagon, losing TIME, MONEY, and even having to CUT SHORT my family vacation to attend this course. In summary, from START TO FINISH, my experience with Le Wagon has been a DISASTER. I cannot RECOMMEND this company to anyone and STRONGLY ADVISE reconsidering any plans to join them. A true NIGHTMARE that I deeply regret having lived through!

Unemmployed, scammed student and scammed TA unpaid, worked intensely for nothing, that was my nightmare I lived.
My class included doctorates, master degree, we all failed the exam. 4/5 students we came back to what we used to do... lol
I prepared 6 month intensely at home to be selected, then 3 intense month at their local.
I don't know shy they rent a local, they said they hardly find teachers to be on-site. Some of the students made 1h30 of transport twice a day to come in their local, to see a remote teacher. Some of them were disappointed.
My biggest regret is : YOU CAN'T justify the experience we get when we did our challenge exercices during the bootcamp. We can't have an internship or experience in a company to complete the lack of practice. I was an alumni and then a teacher assistant (not even paid, and i'll explain later in the message).
I trusted the "reviews" online and thought it could help me to change career or find a job easily.

I had a teacher in-site half of the time. The online teachers were devoted but it has a barrier between the students issue, explain it remotely on an electronic "ticket", wait for his availability.

I had a teacher asistant who just loved to brag, can't explain simply or guide. I was discouraged because you can't ask the real teacher if the teacher assistant is here.
As a teacher assistant, they called me  desperate to  year after my bootcamp, I still can't find, I forgot a lot of what I learned. YES there's a lot to learn in a small amount of time, complex notions, challenges you can't do because we were stuck at the 1st exercise.

They know their bootcamp isn't enough to be efficient to start working.
Sadly a student was discouraged, he said the bootcamp recruiter promised him the teacher will be on-site but that was a lie. He gave up on his good job position and salary to change his career and he want to chooose quality, their organisation is a mess. I reply him I understand, I was lost like him disappointed of the teaching quality at the begining but I'm sure he can succeed if he stay motivated... the discouraged student left on the 3rd day of bootcamp.
Same time like me, sadly at the the end of the 2nd day of trial my head was all over the place, tried to help the students as much as I can, tired to stay awake until 2am to prepare the exercises, understand the solutions.. I was supposed to work 10am to 17pm the the real rythm every teacher assistant here was 9am (put the zoom to see the remote teacher) to ... at least 12pm or 2am.
I told them for the next week to find a teacher assistant that can support better, have more experience to share and enrich the courses, share knowledges or tips of an experimented person ! but they just listened. The day after was when the discouraged student I told earlier left.

[Formation Data - Lille ] Le format theory/pratique (en plus en binôme) est un format excellent pour un apprentissage intensif.

On finit par le projet qui marque vraiment la fin de la formation. Mettre en application tout ce qu'on a appris, avec le groupe avec lequel on a évolué est une très bonne idéee. 
Quant on arrive à la fin des 9 semaines, on a toujours des doutes mais le Wagon nous accompagne là desssus aussi avec des ressources mais surtout une bonne connaissance de "l'après" et la career week. 
En plus, il y a la communauté, internationale, sur laquelle on peut s'appuyer. Aucun regret d'avoir misé sur la réputation et la qualité du Wagon. C'est de la formation, mais c'est aussi une aventure humaine :)

I did the Part-time Data Science online bootcamp from Le Wagon in 2023. 
Let me start with the application process: Everything worked well, they contacted me, I had a quick interview about my prior career and motivation. After that I had to do a little assessment. Nothing complicated. I got accepted and had to pay the fee of about 8.5K Euros. 
The pre-bootcamp was pretty unnecessary to my eyes as all of that stuff was collected from different free web pages, it was very much but most of the stuff was not needed during the bootcamp as it was covered again or not covered at all. The good thing was you could just check it as done because most of that stuff was not new to me.
Let's start with the actual bootcamp: The first day was all about getting to know the other participants and preparing the Laptop/PC for the BC. Most of the stuff went through, they had a good and detailed instruction on github, however, some crucial points were missing (e.g. there were some errors occuring while setting up all the environments in the terminal) so one needed to call a TA, which on the first day took like forever...
The first weeks were about Python, SQL, webscraping, and data science libraries. Nothing to scary, mostly very easy. So far nothing that was worth 8.5K.
What I was really looking forward to was machine learning and deep learning. The machine learning weeks had good, but sometimes too easy tasks. Most of them "stolen" from a popular data-science book by Aurelien Geron which you can buy for about 70 Euros. The lectures were VERY mixed in terms of content quality. Some lecturers were ok, others really TERRIBLE. Sometimes I even skipped the lecture and read the chapter in the book by Geron. 
The deep-learning weeks covered different architectures of neural nets, however only the most basic ones. Nothing up to date was covered, especially not Transformers, which is a pitty as this architecture is mostly used nowadays. So the deep-learning weeks were ok, but pretty basics. Here one sees, that the creators are not keeping up with trends... Also the creators decide to use TensorFlow library, which, I guess, has didactical reasons. However, nowadays mainly PyTorch is used... Also some of the teachers of the live session were not able to answer questions that went beyond the pre-recorded lecture; I had to research on my own...
The last part was about ML-Engineering. Most of the stuff was horrible because of the many difficulties in the tasks and how to solve certain problems so many students had. Also in the 24/7 some questions were not answered at all. Even when I used a ticket with a TA, he could not resolve the problem, also not a second TA...
The final project was ok, however two team members almost did nothing or didn't answer any questions.
Finally and this is most important to my review: The career-week. It was a waste of time. The lectures didn't help at all and the connecting event with companies was a joke. One company was not present at all, the other company not hiring for Data Science, a small start up with 3 members without a businnes-plan, and another company which sounded extremly dubious. 
I wished they would worked together with companies throughout the whole bootcamp maybe already presenting problems from them, which you try to solve so that they can find potentially interesting people. The way Le Wagon is doing didn't work for me.
I regret doing the bootcamp. You should better go for a university degree if you want to get a job in that related field (Data Science, Data Analytics, ML Engineer...)

J'ai suivi une formation en Ruby on Rails avec HTML, CSS, et JS, et je dois dire que c'était une expérience enrichissante. La formation était intense, et le contenu était incroyablement riche.
Ce qui m'a vraiment impressionné, c'est l'approche centrée sur la pratique, le "learning-by-doing". Cela nous a permis d'éviter de nous perdre dans la théorie sur un sujet aussi complexe. Les formateurs étaient tout simplement exceptionnels, d'autant plus qu'ils étaient d'anciens élèves du Wagon. Leur expérience pratique dans le domaine a été d'une grande valeur pour nous, les étudiants.
De plus, leur disponibilité était remarquable. Ils étaient prêts à aider, même en dehors des horaires de cours. J'ai appris énormément en peu de temps, et les exemples fournis étaient si concrets qu'ils seront facilement réutilisables dans le futur.
Cependant, dans le contexte actuel, je dois souligner que trouver du travail peut être un défi, même avec de solides compétences en Ruby on Rails, HTML, CSS, et JS. Cela peut être dû à des facteurs indépendants de la qualité de la formation. En fin de compte, je recommande toujours cette plateforme pour l'apprentissage, et les formateurs étaient vraiment chouettes, d'autant plus qu'ils étaient d'anciens élèves du Wagon, ce qui a ajouté une touche unique à l'ensemble de l'expérience.

Participer au Bootcamp de Le Wagon a été une des meilleures expérience durant mon apprentissage. Le Staff était bienveillant, investi et soucieux dans leur travail. Ces quatre mois qui ont été durs enrichissants mais les encouragements et le support du staff nous a donne la force de continuer.

Pendant ces 16 semaines de formation intensive et de défis stimulants, j'ai acquis une solide compréhension des techniques et des outils d'analyse de données tels que Python, PowerBI, Google BigQuery et Excel. C'était une très belle expérience ; les enseignements étaient très explicites, et nous avions des assistants professionnels sur place et en ligne pour nous aider avec tous nos soucis. Après les vidéos préenregistrées, il y avait des cours dispensés par les professeurs, suivis des défis pour appliquer tout ce que nous venions d'apprendre. C'est la meilleure méthodologie d'apprentissage que j'ai rencontrée.
J'ai fait l'expérience, et c'était extraordinaire. Je le recommande vivement

I recently completed the Le Wagon Data Science bootcamp program in Cologne, and I have to say it was an incredible experience. The program was well-structured and taught by experts in the field who provided us with a comprehensive education in data science.
What I loved most about the Data Science bootcamp was the emphasis on hands-on learning. Throughout the program, we worked on real-world data sets and projects, allowing us to apply our skills and knowledge to solve meaningful problems. The instructors were incredibly knowledgeable and always available to provide guidance and support.
The curriculum covered everything from data cleaning and analysis to machine learning and data visualization, and the instructors did a great job of breaking down complex topics into easily digestible concepts.
The bootcamp was also incredibly well-organized, with weekly events and networking opportunities that allowed us to connect with other students and industry professionals. This was a great way to build a network in the field and get insights into the industry.
Overall, I would highly recommend the Le Wagon Data Science bootcamp program in Cologne to anyone looking to break into the field or further their education in data science. The program was well-designed, and the instructors were knowledgeable, supportive, and passionate about the subject matter. I feel confident in my ability to apply the skills I learned in my career, and I am grateful for the experience.
Life changing, I could not have asked for a better experience

I recently completed Le Wagon's data science bootcamp and I can confidently say that it was one of the best decisions I've made for my career. The program was incredibly well-structured and covered all the essential topics in data science, from programming in Python to machine learning algorithms and data visualization.
The instructors were knowledgeable, patient, and always willing to help us out whenever we had questions or got stuck on a problem. The curriculum was challenging, but the pace was manageable, and the exercises and projects were designed in such a way that we were able to apply what we learned in a real-world context.
What I appreciated most about Le Wagon was the emphasis on collaboration and community. I had the opportunity to work with a diverse group of classmates from all over the world, and we formed strong bonds as we worked together to solve problems and build projects. The post-bootcamp support has also been fantastic, with access to job boards, alumni events, and continued support from the Le Wagon team.
Overall, I would highly recommend Le Wagon's data science bootcamp to anyone looking to transition into a career in data science or upskill in this field. It was a challenging but incredibly rewarding experience, and I feel confident that I now have the skills and knowledge I need to succeed as a data scientist.

L’un des points forts de cette formation est le format des cours. Aussi bien adaptés pour les gens sur place qu’à distance. Les support de cours sont hébergés sur une plateforme ainsi que les corrigés des exercices (mis à disposition le soir). Les exercices sont progressifs et des indices sont donnés, ce qui évite d’être bloqués trop longtemps. 
La formation est dense et intensive, beaucoup de notions et d'outils sont pris en main.
Le staff est bienveillant et tout est mis en place pour encourager la communauté à vivre et à prospérer. On garde l’accès à la plateforme qui permet de garder un accès aux cours, aux réseaux des anciens alumni du Wagon, ainsi qu'à une foule d'autres ressources qui peuvent être utiles aux anciens étudiants.

I recently completed the Le Wagon Nice Batch #1056 Full Stack Developer bootcamp, and I can confidently say that it was one of the best decisions I have made for my career. The 9-week program covered a range of front-end and back-end programming languages and technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Ruby on Rails, and PostgreSQL with Active Record.
What really made this bootcamp stand out was the opportunity to work on real projects with a team. We were able to develop and deploy two websites within the program, including a clone of Airbnb and a financial management tool called My Invest. Working in a team allowed us to learn valuable collaboration skills and provided us with experience in a practical setting.
The teachers and bootcamp manager were exceptional. They were patient, knowledgeable, and always available to help us with any questions or issues we encountered. Their guidance and support were crucial in making the bootcamp a success for me.
Overall, I cannot recommend Le Wagon Nice enough. The program provided me with the skills and knowledge I needed to succeed in the field of Full Stack Development, and the experience was truly amazing. If you are looking for a career change or want to enhance your skills in web development, I highly recommend Le Wagon Full Stack Developer bootcamp. Thank you to the Le Wagon Nice team for an unforgettable experience!

The staff were really friendly and inclusive, really making everyone in my large batch (50 of us!) feel comfortable whilst also pushing us to get as much as we could out of the learning environment. By choosing Ruby and Rails, the course is very focussed around full-stack so bear that in mind - all concepts are fundamentals to get a job as a frontend or backend engineer. Would definitely recommend the process.

Incredible teaching methods, programm very well built, great teachers, great spirit between students... It's simply awesome ! After this bootcamp, you will have strong skills to find a job or to continue to learn by yourself and to become a freelance.

Autant l’avouer, je n’ai jamais aimé l’école. Après avoir arrêté les cours à 16ans, je suis devenu photographe et j’ai exercé ce métier pendant 6 ans avant de vouloir passer à autre chose et de chercher un nouveau challenge.
Par un heureux concours de circonstances, j’ai appris l’existence du bootcamp Le Wagon alors même que je réfléchissais à me former au code. J’ai décidé de m’y inscrire tout en étant assez angoissé à l’idée de retourner dans un milieu scolaire que j’avais auparavant fui. Cette angoisse s’est rapidement dissipée en découvrant comment se déroulait le bootcamp.
Des cours bref et concis le matin, des exercices ludiques à faire à deux ou plus tout le reste de la journée, aidés par le professeur et des professeurs assistants (anciens élèves du bootcamp), le tout dans une ambiance familiale et un lieu qui ne l’est pas moins, sans oublier les évènements et soirées organisées par le staff : tout est pensé pour favoriser un apprentissage en douceur, malgré l’intensité du travail à fournir. Pendant les 9 semaines du bootcamp, j’ai pu apprendre énormément de choses et faire plein de rencontres intéressantes. Je suis fier de pouvoir dire que je suis maintenant développeur fullstack en freelance et je suis ravi d’avoir choisi de tenter l’aventure du Wagon.
J’ai même tellement apprécié que j’y travaille aujourd’hui régulièrement avec plaisir en tant que professeur.
Merci Le Wagon 🥳
Très bonne expérience d'apprentissage. Méthode aboutie et bonne ambiance :)
Incroyable expérience, je recommande à 200% !

Excellente formation à laquelle j’ai participé en 2022 à Paris. Au bout de 8 semaines, nous avons pu livrer une application lors de la démo day, une superbe expérience ! 
J’ai vite trouvé un job en Product dans une start up fintech blockchain à la suite du Wagon.

Un processus de formation très efficace, une école renommée et reconnue sur la marché de l'emploi, ma formation au Wagon fut une expérience inoubliable aussi bien sur le plan humain que technique. Quel que soit votre âge ou votre cursus, je vous recommande fortement de rejoindre la grande famille du Wagon !

J'ai participé à un batch data science à distance, donc sur 6 mois.

La communauté du Wagon sur Slack est super active, c'est un excellent moyen d'échanger, de demander de l'aide ou de trouver du boulot/des projets.
10/10 Le Wagon!

Ces 9 semaines au Wagon ont étaient juste incroyables. J’ai beaucoup appris avec des professeurs très forts ! Bien que le bootcamp soit très intense, on se prête facilement au jeu. Et puis pour compenser il y a toujours une super ambiance et des sorties pour décompresser.
J’ai adoré aussi le fait qu’on puisse proposer et développer notre propre projet, une vraie opportunité !
