I did the Software Engineering program. I think it was a really good program for people who need an external force to achieve discipline, and it was nice that it was a "finished" program of important things to learn so you don't need to do research beforehand and spend too many hours learning things that won't help you ultimately. When I studied however, AI had its big breakthrough and the program was lengthened by a month, and even after finishing the 10-month program there is still lots and lots of work to do before being able to get a job as a programmer unless you have great connections. From my experience, I can't find almost any junior positions because of how the market has changed with AI. It's not really Masterschool's fault though, and if you're really dedicated they will definitely help you learn enough to get hired, although it will most likely take many months more after you have finished the program.

A total waste of time and a scam, avoid at all costs. The training doesn't even have its own content, they just grant you access to sites that would be 4x cheaper to enroll on your own. I'm editing the review so people have in mind Masterschool's reply is full of lies. From my cohort, only one person is working in the field because they already worked before getting the certification which is way far from the 86% they state. Unless they count people landing a job in any field, which is quite deceiving. They're also requesting now I provide them personal information through Trustpilot, trying to pretend they care as if an entire year providing them feedback they've ignored wasn't enough of an insight.
It just takes a quick search on the training chat to find out like 90% of the users who wrote a 5-star review aren't/weren't even students. The disparity of feedback found here against the one you'd find on Reddit is quite suspicious. Beware of positive reviews on Reddit, they come from employees who'd waste their time trying to boost their online popularity instead of actually doing their job.
After promising you'd just pay after landing a job, they keep on harassing you to start paying even though they don't help you at all with the job hunting. On the contrary, they're unable to foresee the reality of the market and realize you won't hold a chance to even get an interview unless you have a degree in Finance/Computer Science or something related to data analysis or the correspondent degrees for Cybersecurity Specialists.
They couldn't even keep their schoolmasters from quitting mid-term which speaks volumes about how they operate.

I enrolled in one of the starting batches i.e. 2021.
1.Back then MSA stated the minimum threshold to be 25-30k. This year they have reduced it to 20k, so they can legally ask you to pay.
2. I enrolled in a program which was completely different than the job I landed. 
MSA stated you wont be liable to pay if you don't work in the same field. This year they have removed that clause. 
Its unfair. and wouldn't recommend unless you really need it.

Entire mail;
You have made excellent progress in the program. To remind you, your current payment plan is the Deferred Payment Plan. This means you are not required to make any payments until you find a job that meets the income threshold.
The deferred tuition payment plan allows you to pay only when you are financially able, reducing significant barriers to high-quality education and career advancement. This is a two-way street, and we need to get accurate updates on your employment status regularly.

My experience with Masterschool so far (since January 2023).
The instructors, the team, and the student community:
The instructors are great, and the student community is also very supportive. It can be challenging to learn online, but I appreciate the flexibility of the program and the fact that I can reach out to Masterschool for help whenever I need it. I feel like I'm not on my own, and I belong to a community of learners.
The level of support:
The support I've received has been great. Whenever I have a question, I can get help quickly and easily through the chat bubble. I'm happy with the level of support that I've received so far.
The learning material:
The learning material is great. I personally found the LinkedIn Learning material to be a bit dry, but I appreciated the feedback that I provided, and the material has improved since then. I'm enjoying the ACI learning material, and I think it's more "alive" than the LinkedIn Learning material (I don't mean to say that all LinkedIn Learning videos are bad, LinkedIn is a great platform. There are probably some good ones out there. It just depends on the video, lecturer, and topic). Tryhackme is also a great tool, and the ACI labs are helpful as well. I'm also grateful for the career preparation material that Masterschool provides. It's motivating to hear positive words from the instructors and Masterschool masters, and it's helpful to have guidance on how to learn and build a career in cybersecurity. As I am now searching for a new Job. I believe that I am able to find in cyber an entry-level position as a cybersecurity analyst, soc analyst, windows admin, or network admin.
Anything else that I feel is relevant:
I've seen that the program has changed a bit recently, which I think is a good thing. I need more materials and support to feel more at home with all the tools. I think it's important to have enough time to practice with the tools, so I would like to see the program slow down a bit in some areas.
Overall, I'm really enjoying my experience with Masterschool. I'm learning a lot, and I feel like I'm part of a supportive community. I'm grateful for the opportunity to learn from the instructors and other students, and I'm excited to continue my journey in cybersecurity.

I have completed the course, but the question remains: was it a worthy investment?
Course Material:
The course relies heavily on Udacity and Youtube for instructional content. Yes, you read it right, they utilize content from Youtube developers for teaching. It's not their original content. Udacity is used for small projects or tests at the end of each section. However, these projects are not suitable for a future portfolio, despite the assurance that you will be creating numerous projects. Employers won't be interested in these; only the final capstone project holds any potential value.
Moreover, if you're interested in free learning resources, they utilize content from Youtubers like Travesy, The Net Ninja, DevEd, and Web Simplified.
I strongly advise against wasting your money. Essentially, they're providing you with a roadmap, which you can create yourself.
Reflecting on my experience, I felt overlooked and neglected. Out of 200 participants, about 10 seemed to receive preferential treatment, presumably those who they believe will repay the £11,000 fee with their new jobs.
I attempted to join this privileged group, but to no avail.
Why are they considered "special"?
Management moved them into separate groups for advanced training ahead of time.
They were encouraged to collaborate and work on portfolio projects, including the capstone.

Amazing Experience :)
The entire program was split into two -
 - the bootcamp itself which is a partnership between Masterschool and Practicum
 - the career accelerator portion, which was led 100% by Masterschool.
The bootcamp was extremely informative and a very well designed program, particularly for those that are good at self-learning. The format is almost fully self-study online “sprints” in the form of a particular web dev concept/s and then a project to tie in those newly learned skills. Or more accurately, a continuation of the same big project that we kept building up through the process of the bootcamp, and applying the skills learned in the current sprint to that project. Ultimately you come out with several rather large Fullstack, end-to-end projects that you have built up and are confident to present on your portfolio, and discuss during interviews.
Regarding the Career Accelerator portion - I honestly did not expect the level of support and hand-holding that I received during that process. You are taken in and processed fully to be able to confidently apply and present yourself in interviews. There are no more fears when it comes to writing your CV. You are trained to make your applications perfect from both an HR perspective, as well as from a technical standpoint.
You are never alone, you will be guided both by HR personnel, as well as developers that are actively working in the field.
Every person in the career accelerator receives their own personal web developer mentor who is skilled in the industry and caters to your personal needs, developing a unique relationship with you and your particular background.
Every aspect of the application process is covered. CV’s, mock HR interviews, mock technical interviews, building up your online presence, job application tracking, portfolio projects, etc.
I never felt for a minute that I was lost in the process.
Albeit, the procedure of landing your first junior job in the industry is never easy, and takes lots of work, as long as you follow Masterschool’s lead and follow the steps laid out by the career accelerator, you are sure to land your first gig in tech.

The biggest problem I found while doing this was support if I need help understanding a particular problem, concept, or issue it would take a long time to solve, even if I couldn’t resolve the issue I was facing. I would often purchase another course similar made by someone else to see if they explained the concept that would be easier for me to understand than didn’t help and I got demotivated and frustrated and lost interest and stopped for a while.
Back in May of 2021, the fire for Web development was reignited, I was more determined to achieve my goals and do something that I’ve always had a strong interest in and passion for. I started looking into Bootcamps. There were so many to choose from, Master school being one of them, at first, I just looked at it and carried on my search. Other boot camps were using technologies that I wasn’t interested in learning, Still, Masterschool kept coming up in my searches, Facebook ads, etc.
I took a good look at the Web development course and found that they were exactly what I was looking for, so I thought I’d apply. The application process was simple and easy to follow. The team are helpful and answered my questions quickly and clearly.
Now, I am about halfway through the course, and I must say that this was the best thing I have done! The instructors are amazing, they are always on hand to offer support when you need it, and the lessons are easy to follow. Your school masters will support you, offer you advice and be there for whatever you need. The most important part I think that’ll help you through this, is the community, the other students here have been amazing, we are all here to learn and we are all here to support each other regardless of our knowledge, ask questions, answer questions, don’t be afraid to get somethings wrong, it's leaning, take the initiative and form study groups for you to study together. Studying alone is difficult but if you have a place where you can go knowing there are others, will make this experience so much better.
I have made many friends here studying in Master school, friends that I’ll always stay in contact with for a very, very long. I hope that I will be able to remain in contact with some of the staff that I have met along my journey, these people have made a lasting impression on me pushing me to my limits and beyond.
Thank you Master School for the work you have done with me so far, looking for to the next few months.

It is hard to learn coding, and sometimes we all struggle, but here nobody is afraid to say it, and everybody helps each other to get back up.

It's being a great experience. The Data Analysis course is very challenging, but in a good way that keeps you motivated to keep going. I got a job as data analyst and I didn't even finish the course yet, you really learn the main skills to get a job on the area. I could only recommend it.

I finished the data analysis program 4 months ago (Masterschool and Practicum collaboration). The staff at Masterschool was very committed to our success. I started an amazing job 2 months ago.

I’m an optimist- and think that good time’s is ahead. If you're willing to go for a journey and work hard..

I started the course in Jan 2022. It is taught in english. The data analysis learning part goes on for around 7 months. And then you start the career accelerator part where you learn about all of the tools and skills needed to apply for a job.
The 7-month course is taught with 3 different tools: Udacity-hosted main course, Datacamp for practice and daily webinars for understanding thr projects on udacity and advanced topics. One can book a meeting with any of the teachers for further assistance. 
One is required to invest around 20 hours/week to complete and understand the topics and projects. The best thing about the udacity course is that you really need to invest the time they ask you to. That means, it is very comprehensive. The udacity course is divided in sub sections. After every section you have a project, you need to complete the project according to the guidelines. The assistance at udacity would review it and won't pass the project until the guidelines are met. That said, you learn a lot with this hit and trial method.
Some constructive criticism would be that the career accelerator should not start at the end of the course, rather it should go hand in hand with the course. Because what helps to get a job at the end is if you have a student job experience. And applying for that is hard work. For that you need to understand a lot of stuff and that could be a tooic to cover with the course. 
If you are ready to put in thr work, the extra effort to land a job no matter what, then you will find the course really good for you. You have to pay nothing almost nothing when you start the course and do a contract to pay them back after you land a job. And they take full responsibility that you get one. That is a big factor for a student who can't pay a lot of money to learn something. And they are always ready to help. Put in the work and persistence, you will benefit.
Gurinder Arora

I went through the entire DS course of Practicum100. The course is very good:
1) You get full tutoring support throughout the entire course.
2) You don't have exams or group project and other awful old school university bull****. 
3) For each of your projects you receive a thorough review and you have a chance to fix and improve it several times.
What I did not like:
1) Learning DS in months is a bit of an impossible task. Don't get me wrong, the course materials are really good but the amount of stuff (high level linear algebra, statistics, and programing skills) you'll need to learn is a bit too much for 10 months. You will find yourself studying outside of the course's curriculum to complete what you do not know. It's not a bad thing but be prepared for that when you sign up for the program.
2) Be ready to study alone. Not all the time you'll be able to find someone to study with (since it's a course you do at your own pace) so sometimes your study Budy will be behind you or ahead of you. 
All in all, I'm very happy with my choice to study at Practicum100 - I did it instead of a university diploma and I was able to find a job in the field with little hussel.

DO NOT SPEND THE $15,000. Please look elsewhere. 
I started in the Data Analytics school with Charlotte Chaze at the end of June and I withdrew from the program at the end of August. Right off the bat I should've known this was not extremely organized/researched much. 
First, they advertise with industry "experts" but that is EXTREMELY EXTREMELY misleading as they do not actually do any of the teaching and you talk with the once a week in a "School Master Live Session". Usually these sessions were more of a background on the individual and offered no real help 
Secondly, my interview for the program was awful. The interviewer scolded me for my background not being blurred and the lighting being bad. It left me with a very bad taste in my mouth. However, I decided to give Masterschool another chance. Bad idea. 
The program is split up by weeks, usually with each week being a new course with there being live sessions every week. They communicate through slack and have different channels set up which I thought was nice. Immediately I noticed there was no organization on how to ask question/get feedback from the "instructors" so it became a big jumbled mess in the chat that was entirely too difficult to navigate to get any real value from. 
Now I say instructors in quotations because they quite possibly hired anyone with data analytics experience. This sounds great, however, it became clear very quickly that they had no clue how to teach. These live sessions usually became a random hour long session of monologues and jokes by the instructors with such little being actually taught I usually ended up more confused than when I started the session. Masterschool also switched up instructors throughout the course so you were learning contrasting things from each instructor as they each taught you their way and not a general way of programming.  
Aside from the live sessions you also have independent work. Now this is where I really started to question what I signed up for. The independent work was outsourced to a different data analytics bootcamp type program, Udacity. This was very strange to me because I had previously research Udacity before deciding on going with Masterschool(I would suggest Udacity's program as it is much cheaper and you are basically doing the same thing in Masterschool). This ultimately was the breaking point for me because I realized I was essentially paying extra for Masterschool's "instructors" to teach me nothing, crack jokes, talk off topic, figure out how to work zoom WHILE ON THE CALL, painfully try to answer questions with way too much explanation it usually took 5-10 minutes per question(these live sessions and instructors were a huge turnoff for me if you cannot tell). 
Now, you're not just paying extra for the instructors, but also the school master and their career advice. This was a phony lie and I will explain what happens/how it works. I'm not sure what I expected from the school masters but it was more than what they put out considering they were the face of the programs. Like I said they did none of the teaching and had once a week live sessions about their backgrounds and "why data analytics" topics. They also had one-on-one meetings but those and the once a week live sessions never actually happened as my school master went on vacation and then just never came back. 
Save the effort and look into other bootcamps/programs, maybe even the Udacity one. Maybe even check out associate degree programs since $15,000/$300 per credit hr is 50 hours. This program/school/company was so not it and I cannot recommend you look somewhere else more. I'd say the only good thing this brought me was the motivation to enroll into a computer science program at a local university. 
Hope this was helpful!
The staff is amazing!! In less than a year me and most of all my peers landed a job and the help and carrying never stops

I have a terrible experience with the interview. The interviewer was very rude. When I wanted to ask questions, he stated you don't ask questions here, I am the one who asks and you are the one who answers.

Since graduating from Yandex Practicum in Data Analytics, I have been enrolled in Masterschool's Career Accelerator program. During the track, we received assistance in building our CVs, LinkedIn profiles, and GitHub profiles. The training included webinars and simulations of HR and Tech interviews. 
However, the most significant thing about Masterschool is the Community. Mentors who provide us with support, meet with us on Zoom or invite us to come to the office to discuss our thoughts, suggestions, doubts, and experiences. Students you are gathering with to study together and support each other on our shared path to finding a job. Alumni who share their experiences and connections with us.
Masterschool is indeed a Community, where you are looking for a job together, and each of us contributes to the building of this community. For mentors is important to bring us to the result - getting the job. One of us succeeding is the future success of another student.

The very structure of this course is aimed at ensuring that the student finds a position upon its completion:
* Students are constantly in touch with mentors and other representatives of the course, receiving support in various aspects: from completing exercises on the platform to completing documents for requesting grants for the course.
* Mentors work in the relevant positions and pass on up-to-date knowledge and hacks in handling the tools that they use themselves.
The job search assistance program shows that the whole job search process, from writing a CV to communicating with HR, is a skill that can be developed, and mock-up interviews practice sometimes make you face even more difficult tasks than those you got during a real interview.
* The Masterschool team is composed of open and friendly people who are really passionate about their work, and this affects the quality of it.

1. Structure: There are hard deadlines for projects submission, but it felt like the virtual training was tailored for my needs (scale from "self-study step-by-step" up to "mostly self-study with feedback"), so I could flexibly juggle between material learning and other life obligations. Also, some learning materials require time to digest, in that sense, I loved the provided regularly scheduled 1-on-1 meetings with instructors. 
2. Communication: A repeated phrase I heard at least dozen times from tutors and instructors: "Teaching others is the best way to learn yourself". A constant reminder that we should collaborate and support each other, in that sense, I loved the virtual group practices and brainstorming with amazing fellow colleagues. That feeling when group of people decided to grow together is magical!
3. Professionalism: From setting up students' learning mindset to assigning mentors for guidance and support. In my opinion it is a key to effective knowledge transmission.
I've started the training out of curiosity (always had the tendency for patterns and trends) and received a whole new appreciation for the power of data analysis and storytelling. I'm grateful to have been a part of it and happy to join the data community.

Masterschool offered several opportunities of internships after the program. I was accepted to one of them, got real industry experience and then successfully landed a first job.
So, if you’re interested to start a new path in data analytics - this program is a great opportunity to do that.

Great platform to enter the datascience realm. The lectures are top top notch, the meterial was perfectly aligned with the industry requirements and the projects design were challenging enough to boost my skills, accompanied with great support to help me keep going. I highly recommend!
Masterschool helped me to start my career as a software developer. Excellent staff. Overall, great experience.

As a person who was just building his career with a very little exerience abroad, it was very hard for me to improve myself relative to the Israeli tech market and develop a network, which is tremendously critical for finding a job in the ,so called, start-up nation. While looking for a job, I came across with their course link that promises success based payment and immediately started searching about it. At first, I thought it may be a scam but after the elimination phases of the program, I understood that it is very serious and I had to go for it.
The course itself has quite of workload, you should keep it in mind if you already are busy. But it's totally worth dealing with this intensity. Duirng that intensity, you have a lot of material to carefully read for being able to complete the excercises in the interactive coding platform provided. When ever you are stuck with an expercise or reading material you can reach out to the team who are well experienced. Additionally, you have to be able to finish projects including real business problems every two weeks, so that you can move forward in the whole program. These projects add a lot to your analytical approach to the problems and to your coding skills to implement your solutions. 
After finishing the final project, the course finishes and there is a career accelerator track which helps you learn how to distinguish among other canditates who apply to the same jobs. You learn how to arrange your CV, how to write your cover letter before applying for jobs and how to summurize your elevator pitch while making unplanned connections. In addition to these, there are also some internship opportunities. I was lucky to have an intern position.
If you are considering building your new career in data analysis, Masterschool is the best place to start!

I was looking to make a professional shift for a while, coding and web development was something I was really interested in but making the decision and learning on your own can be daunting. 
And so I've accidently happened to find Masterschool, I liked the curriculum which is MERN stack (Mongo, Express, React & Node.js).
As well as having classes with professional mentors you have an online platform that makes the learning easier and fun. You will learn ALOT in a very short time.
I gained a lot of new skills and a better understanding of the development process. Technical and soft skills as well.
You will meet new people, just like you, at different levels of experience and you learn together online, we set up zoom meetings and helped each other and started our own small community.
Later when you finish the course, a team of HR professionals help you market yourself better by improving your CVs, your linkedIn identity, teach you how to network better, prepare you for interviews with interview simulations, as well as other very helpful tools, you'll join weekly meetups where you can update about your progression as well as hear from others.
There are weekly peer to peer meetings where you're being prepared for technical interviews with real-world technical interview questions.
The bottom line is, you and Masterschool share the same interests, so you becoming a successful professional working web developer is everyone first and last imperative.

I always felt like I get I have always received personal help whenever I need it. Masterschool really does it's best to keep the students commited.
 While I was doing the data analyst bootcamp I found a job as web-developer, so I can't verify that the skills I learned are a guarantee for finding a job after graduation. Even though I never worked as a data analyst in business, I think that the projects I work on are a very good basis for taking this path.
The community was great. I only met motivated people, with positive vibes and great helpfulness if you have not made any progress on your own.
Even though I found a job as web- developer I am still in contact with the colleagues of Masterschool and they will help me for my next meeting with my boss when it comes to salary negotiations.

Yandex Practicum is a great program for data analysts looking for junior-mid positions. It allows acquiring a solid skill-set required in the industry plus forms a business way of thinking. Besides practice exercises, the program involves a significant time devotion to applied projects that are really handy to organize into a portfolio for a further job hunt. Finally, the study process is accompanied by an amazing tutors' team, career accelerator mentors, and the student community itself, which grows in the spirit of collaboration and true curiosity beyond the program's syllabus encouraging students to catch up.

If you 're looking for a guide inside world of technologies so Master school is your right choice! Responsive mentors, that always find time to your questions will follow you during all your trip and will let you know what to do, Jast join their instructions and job of dreams will find you. Here mentors let you know things that you never thought to ask, about things that start be obious only with experience. But you can get it right now.

In the last 10 months, I participated the Data Science Track of the Practicum100 program. During this period I learned a lot of theoretical knowledge and practical skills in all of the fields related to Data Science and Machine Learning. This staff gives a push to my career as a Data Scientist. I also meet many good people whom I will keep to be in contact with and will be part of a network of Data Scientists. I highly recommend this course.
I highly reccomend the Practicum Fullstack program, great guidance, you learn relevant tech which helped me to land a front end job relatively fast

A “dream job” is a cliché but that is exactly what Masterschool helped me get after 760 hours and 20 projects of very intensive Data Science bootcamp. 
Students are accepted to Masterschool from all walks of life. Some have no university degree. Some wish to have a career change. Masterschool grants everyone a chance to have a go, regardless of their background. The success-based tuition model makes it even more student-friendly. 
Once selected as one of the hundred in the screening process, you enroll on a Python-centric online programme where the first half is geared towards building the foundation of your knowledge and practical skills in Data Analysis. Should you then choose the Data Science track, the second half of the programme provides you with the minimum viable knowledge and equips you enough to deepen your knowledge and skills further in the area of your interest. 
You are supported by a dedicated group of tutors and mentors round the clock. The programme puts a lot of emphasis on creating a safe learning environment where students can open up to ask questions, experiment new ideas and are encouraged to help one another.
English being the “language of the high-tech industry”, the programme is entirely taught in English, which gives the students access to the plethora of Data Science resources available on the internet as well as a common vocabulary with guest speakers from all over the world. 
They do not stop after your have acquired your MVK though. Masterschool then goes on to show you how to make yourself marketable in the job market. You receive guidance from knowledgeable and caring staff on CV writing, LinkedIn profile polishing, human resources and technical interviews through 1:1 sessions, group practices and mock interviews. All this while, you are encouraged to maintain your Data Science knowledge as you work on assignments that are sent to you periodically. 
If the world of data interests you but a/another university degree seems daunting for you, Masterschool may hold the ticket for you to dive right in!

I enrolled on the Data Analyst boot camp in September 2021; it was quite an intensive program, especially for someone without coding background. 
The program was eye-opening towards the data world I didn't even know existed, and the delivery was so well done that it made me fall in love with data. The program trained 100 talented students to be successful Data Analysts in 8 months via an online platform and independent work on real-life projects with professional analysts' tools.
The platform's user-friendliness, the way the material was delivered to you, the real-life projects, and the constant support from the tutors and the students made this a unique learning experience.
All the tools like Python and SQL that the program covered helped me develop my technical skills, which landed me a job not long after completing the program.
In addition, after graduation Masterschool's Career Accelerator was a great help in interview simulations, CV polishing, 1:1 sessions and webinar with graduates who successfully landed a job in the industry and offered great advice.
And all of that, on a success base agreement!
I would very much recommend the program to everyone who wants to jumpstart or boost their career!

I'm happy to know Masterschool, it's a great community of amazing professionals. They are always ready to advise or help with something. And educational program (I did data analysis course) is easily applied in work practice. Thank you everyone dear Masterscool community

Excellent support on all the way to the next step in my career. I really appreciate Masterschool dedication to their mission helping student to achieve high results and uncover the potential.
Highly recommend to go with Masterschool on your new journey.

I completed the course for Data Analytics in 2021.
During the course, Masterschool provided active support and assistance.
After completing the course, there was also a 3-month course on a career accelerator, thanks to which many were able to find a job in high-tech.
In general, I am very glad that I got here.

The Data Analyst Professional training bootcamp was quiet intensive and coming from non-technical background it was difficult to get the grasp of programming language. But due to the user-friendliness of the bootcamp, clear explanation with examples, very convenient technicality of the web page, very helpful tutors and mentors made it a lot easier and exciting.

Masterschool learning process was just amazing. Immersive practical experience is lots of fun. Experienced pros reviewed student works explaining all the details. While I had some sleepless nights handling some difficult tasks, it was inspiring and useful all the way. You can actually feel yourself working as a data analyst while going through the numerous hands-on projects.
Y100 program offered success-based tuition to the selected cohort of hundred students. Competition was pretty tough, I was so surprised and happy to find myself selected after second attempt.
Python coding practice was just great. Data visualization with all the colorful graphs is my fav part. Statistics was the biggest challenge for me, but super interesting as well. Business analytics with all it's metrics was also difficult at times, but I think I did well.
Tutors support was excellent and always available, student community was also very helpful.
I personally didn't attend the career accelerator part very well because of my personal issues, and nevertheless it helped me a lot!! Thanks to CV reviewing I got my best CV ever in the end.
It is a great opportunity to start a tech career, and an amazing set of skills to possess. Can recommend the course to anyone interested in the subject.

For anyone considering this program, I highly recommend it. In my experience, they went above and beyond what was advertised.
Like any skeptical person, I had a lot of doubt about what would be offered in a "success-based" course. What kind of quality can be produced from a very low-cost entry point?
In this case, since the school does best when you do better, they are highly motivated to provide a comprehensive program that will empower students to achieve a higher quality of living. 
Any person seeking a starting position in a high-tech career with novice technical skills can learn enough in just the first few months of their course to gain a respectable starting position in their chosen field.
The instructor for my course was inspiring and successful in the field and was passionate about teaching the lessons from their experience. All of the support staff were incredibly responsive; I did not wait long to receive feedback, notes, and suggestion for projects. (Which is how it is in the workplace: gaining information from a team to successfully complete a work project.)
Every facet of the program prepares students to enter the workforce with confidence.
The lessons can be done at your own pace and weave a humorous, engaging storyline throughout.
Not everyone will have the same results, but while I was working on the final project I was simultaneously interviewing at my top choices for tech companies. Today, I am coming up on one year of working at my first choice!
The initial investment is small but the rewards are great.

In general, I really enjoyed the Data Analyst program. It wan't easy at all, I had many sleepless nights, but it had most of the things data analyst might need. Especially helpful were reviews from experienced data analysts who were grading students' projects. 
At the time of my learning, the program was short on SQL knowledge and had no Excel exercises, but I heard it was fixed recently. More important for me was Python part, since I was already employed as a data analyst and was using primarily SQL. 
The Python part of the course was what allowed me to find a better job in the end. Of course, CV reviews and interviews simulations offered after the course also helped. 
I need to add here, that the program alone won't guarantee you a job, especially if you have no experience.  But I have seen many fellow students who practiced more, did more projects, and continued learning after the program, and succeeded finding a job in the end even with no experience.

I highly reccomend the Practicum Data Analysis Course.  The course is the perfect combination between theory knowldge and practical skills which (with hard work) enables to start a career as a data analyst. The course is very well orginized and the mentorship is great.

The course was great, I learned a lot and had fun in the process.
Niv is the best!

I finished Practicum Data Analysis Course. We learned Basics of Statistics, Probability Theory, SQL, Data Analysis and Visualisation with Python, Tableau, a little Machine Learning. It was extremely interesting and not boring at all. All personal projects were challenging. But each submitted personal project gives you feeling of pushing your limits far and far away. Very recommend this course (Data Analysis) if you want to start your life in world of data or if you want to change your career path, be more confident and data driven.
The curse was great
Thanks to the Masterschool I graduated from the excellent course and got a job. It was a real help with the seeking of the work. Recommend it for everyone.

Highly recommended
Going in to the Practicum Data Analyst training program, I was pretty clueless on the real definition and the work of a data analyst.
This program allow you to get a glimpse of the world of a data analyst - from the basics of understanding data structures and types, data visualization and exploration, through understanding business KPI's and conveying your conclusion to stakeholders and business owners.
The advantage given in the course is not only for getting a job - it is also a great advantage in the day-to-day work.
Finishing the course is not easy, but it gives you a needed booster when trying to make your first steps in your career.
Very good program that really does provide with necessary skills to change professions

Although sometimes there were technical difficulties in the platform's tasks, and I sometimes experienced difficulties understanding certain details of assignments, the tutors and the entire community were helpful. Overall, I would recommend to people.

While pursuing my Masters, my dream was to become a Data Analyst. To begin, I took a few courses on other bootcamps, but I was just learning without a clear path.
I came across an ad offering to sponsor and train 100 talented students to be successful Data Analysts in Germany. Lucky enough to be selected among the first cohort, I enjoyed every bit of their excellent training and they kept to their words as promised. With the opportunity to learn with other talented students, coupled with great content, I learned and shared with the best which helped my progress a lot. After completing numerous hands-on projects, I felt much confident with tools and software like Python, SQL, and Tableau.
